intro: Lophira simplex, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable timber trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, typically yellowish-green in color. The tree produces woody capsules as fruits, which contain several seeds enclosed in a fleshy aril.
